text: Crispy Crunch is a brand of chocolate bar. They are chocolate bars that have been filled with peanut butter flake and covered in a chocolate coating. Crispy Crunch is owned by Cadbury. The chocolate bar was first created in 1930 by William Neilson employee Harold Oswin. The trading card company Pro Set would begin to sell the chocolate bar in the United States during the 1990s. It stopped being sold in the US after the Pro Set company went bankrupt. == References == ==Other websites== * (Archive) Category:1930 establishments Category:Canadian food Category:Chocolate bars
title: Crispy Crunch
